TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a LOC national who was born in DATE and is currently serving a prison sentence in FAC . He was represented before the ORG by Mr R. Mlinarić and Mr PERSON , lawyers practising in GPE .
CARDINAL . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Government of GPE were informed of the case and invited to exercise their right to intervene if they wished to do so . On DATE the Government of GPE informed the ORG that they did not wish to exercise their right to intervene in the present case .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . On DATE I.P. , a well - known NORP journalist , and his business associate PERSON were killed by the explosion of an improvised device placed under ORG ’s car , which was parked in front of his publishing company . The explosion also caused injuries to CARDINAL employees of the publishing company and considerable material damage to the surrounding buildings and nearby parked cars .

CARDINAL . NORP The police immediately started enquiries into the above events and soon learned that a certain GPE , GPE and DATE were implicated and that an unknown person was supposedly aiding them in fleeing the country . It was therefore decided to arrest these individuals . The Police Chief ( PERSON ) issued an oral order that the arrests be carried out by an anti - terrorist team of ORG ( Specijalna policija , PERSON hereinafter “ the ORG ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG Attorney ’s ORG suzbijanje korupcije i organiziranog kriminaliteta DATE hereinafter “ the ORG Attorney ’s ORG ” ) indicted several individuals , including the applicant , before ORG ( Županijski sud u GPE ) on charges of conspiracy to kill FAC and of carrying out the plan .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Županijski sud u GPE ) found the applicant guilty on the charge of incitement to conspiracy to commit aggravated murder and sentenced him to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) upheld the applicant ’s conviction , increasing his sentence to DATE imprisonment .
CARDINAL . On DATE , at TIME , the ORG arrested the applicant together with ORG and PERSON at the NORP petrol station off the motorway near the town of ORG .

CARDINAL . According to the Government the CARDINAL individuals concerned resisted arrest and force had to be used against them . CARDINAL members of the ORG sustained injuries . The applicant also sustained injuries while a standard restraint technique was applied against him during the arrest .
CARDINAL . According to the applicant , even though he was not resisting arrest , he was severely beaten by several police officers all over his head and body .
CARDINAL . After being arrested the applicant was brought to the LOC of FAC in GPE . There he received medical assistance at CARDINAL a.m. on DATE from an emergency medical team .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was questioned by an investigating judge of ORG in the presence of CARDINAL defence lawyers . He did not make any complaints about the conduct of the police .
CARDINAL . On DATE , upon his admission to detention , the applicant was examined by a prison doctor who found that he had haematomas around both eyes and an abrasion on his face .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , in the further course of the proceedings he complained to ORG , the investigating judge , the State Attorney ’s Office , the police and other authorities of the violence used against him during his arrest . However , he did not submit any documents supporting those allegations .

CARDINAL . The documents submitted by the parties show that in a letter of CARDINAL DATE , addressed to ORG ) the applicant complained , inter alia , of alleged ill - treatment by the police during his arrest .
CARDINAL . No investigation was ever opened in connection with the applicant ’s allegations of ill - treatment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted civil proceedings against the ORG before ORG ( Općinski građanski sud u GPE ) , claiming damages for his alleged ill - treatment by the police . It appears that these proceedings are still pending before the first - instance court .

CARDINAL . In a constitutional complaint of DATE , lodged against ORG judgment of DATE given in the criminal proceedings against him , the applicant alleged that the police officers had used force against him during his arrest and had caused him numerous bodily injuries . On DATE ORG found that these allegations , in so far as they were admissible and susceptible to be addressed within ORG proceedings , did not reveal any violation of the applicant ’s human rights and fundamental freedoms guaranteed by LAW .
